data.title: ShellTask executed in wrong working directory when the Terminal is reused
data.body:
I've added multi root support for the npm script runner. I now pass the cwd of the package.json containing the script to the ShellTask as an option. This works fine in the single root case and the reuse of the terminal works.

In the multi root case a different cwd can be passed for npm scripts that are located in different root folders. In this setup a script can be executed inside the wrong working directory.

As a workaround I killed the Terminal in between task runs and the issue doesn't show up.

- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-tidyhtml|anw|1.5.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
gitlens|eam|4.3.1

debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6
json-organizer|rin|0.0.3
vim|vsc|0.9.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In the preferences, set explorer.autoReveal to false
2. open a project, open file A
3. open another file, B
4. select file A again the editor
3. Do cmd-shit-E to "view file in explorer"

Expected: the explorer should scroll to where the file is (opening folders as necessary)
Actual: the explorer is selected, but it only highlights and focuses on whatever was already selected

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Intellisense not working, stops working after a couple of seconds
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 0.12.5 (16F73)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Uninstall all VSCode instances and all extensions
2. Install VS Code stable
3. Open a new .js-file
4. Intellisense doesn't work. Developer tools throws errors.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

This looks like being the error message:
```
activating extension `vscode.typescript` failed: [vscode.typescript]: Proposed API is only available when running out of dev or with the following command line switch: --enable-proposed-api vscode.typescript.
t.$localShowMessage @ /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:28
```

Error normal start:
![normalstart](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1493018/28377893-ec5920ee-6c73-11e7-8801-30584e81df2c.png)

Error `code --disable-extensions`
![noextensions](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1493018/28377894-ed5d0906-6c73-11e7-8a93-679a9693b6d0.png)

data.title: Add Sync (Rebase)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I suggest having a *Sync (Rebase)* option under *Sync*.

Most of the times I find myself having to manually run the two commands simply because sync uses regular pull. I don't want to edit my git configuration to always rebase either.

I think it makes sense to have a *Sync (Rebase)* option since there already is a *Pull (Rebase)*, and sync uses pull.

data.title: Emmet wrap with abbreviation does not work with multiple cursors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.1 (2648980a697a4c8fb5777dcfb2ab110cec8a2f58, 2017-07-13T19:08:57.197Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In an HTML document, select text on multiple lines
2. Use the `insertCursorAtEndOfEachLine` shortcut (`Alt` + `Shift` + `I` on Mac) to create a multi-cursor selection
3. Select multiple words on each line (e.g. with `Shift` + `⬅️`)  
4. Call up the _Emmet: Wrap with abbreviation_ command and enter e.g. `span`

Results:
Only the first selection is wrapped with the abbreviation and the multiple cursors / selections are discarded.

Expected:
All selections are wrapped with the abbreviation and the selections are preserved.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (9a308d1128df9af90e84b2988bce4f57f885b1c3, 2017-07-19T06:31:43.209Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- ng-template|Ang|0.1.4 code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2 sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0 Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2 project-manager|ale|0.18.1 path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.7 tslint|eg2|0.16.0 auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14 Angular2|joh|2.4.0 ecdc|mit|0.10.3 HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3 vscode-autoprefixer|mrm|2.0.0 vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.4.1 angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17 stylelint|shi|0.27.0 change-case|wma|1.0.0 (4 theme extensions excluded) --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Take a simple paragraph of text, such as ````html

Our forms for collecting address-related information follow a standard design. Specific input elements will vary according to the form’s audience and purpose.

```` 2. Run "Format Document" (shift-option-F) 3. You get ````html

Our forms for collecting address-related information follow a standard design. Specific input elements will vary according to the form’s audience and purpose.

```` I don't see why this is. I would expect the text inside the `p` tags to remain as is. ![jul-19-2017 11-03-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/835148/28374293-52d2a98c-6c72-11e7-9fcc-7c7b6c662254.gif)

---|---|---

---

Quite popular (350K) and 5-starred extension Git Lens doesn't work with the latest insiders build anymore.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VS Code  with the installed Gitlens extension https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/
2. Notice that the extension doesn't work anymore: it doesn't show in the status bar the author of the current line, doesn't show blame output, doesn't provide many of its features in via the command palette.

I bisected the recent VS Code changes and here's the commit that breaks the extension: 531b6b1c219fb4b18df6a429d19ed2649c2c61ac

data.title: Look up word definition on Mac OS Sierra behaving strangely with VS Code text editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: Mac OSX Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Trigger the "look up & data detectors" feature with a trackpad. This is typically a force click or three finger tap.
2. When looking up the definition of a word in the text editor, other random tokens in the editor will be looked up instead. This does not happen with any other text editors that I've seen.

data.title: Go to Definition shouldn't open file when there are multiple definitions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create two files:

```
// foo.cpp
#include "foo.h"
int main() {
    return FOO;
}

// foo.h
#ifdef DEBUG
#define FOO 1
#else
#define FOO 2
#endif

```

2. Ctrl-click or command-click on `FOO` in `foo.cpp`

VSC realises that FOO has multiple definitions and opens an interface to let you choose which one to go to. The problem is it does that after opening `foo.h` and jumping to a random `#define FOO`. It's really confusing. Look at this screenshot! I barely understand what is going on in this UI, and this is a simple example! Imagine actual code...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376842/28370365-05244f72-6c92-11e7-8ed6-f9247f153911.png)

Wouldn't this make much more sense (excuse my poor image editing)?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376842/28370342-f53aadae-6c91-11e7-992a-2c4f860f3d0d.png)

This happens in all languages as far as I can tell.

data.title: Added API to access editor markers
data.body: As of now there is no public API to access markers in monaco-editor. This PR adds method `editor.getModelMarkers`. Should resolve https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/30.

data.title: Brand new storage for workspaces can be frustrating
data.body:
Refs: #30722

I am working on vscode all the time and now I started working on multi root with also vscode-docs. Everything is great except I get pestered by a lot of ux things which I have dismissed already in the past. These include:

1. Welcome page
2. Workspace recommendations
3. TS check

Probably many others.
I do not have a suggestion on how to improve this, but we should be aware that this can be frustrating. Maybe some transition strategy for the storage would be useful.

data.title: Unsupported settings should not be shown on left hand side for folder settings
data.body:
Refs: #30722

Currently we show all settings on the left hand side for the folder settings, this can be confusing as the user is not aware these are not supported for multi root workspace. Especially since we have edit actions that have no effect

data.title: Edit setting button broken for folder settings
data.body:
Refs: #30722

1. Multi root, open folder settings
2. Click on the edut action in the margin -> no effect, no matter what settings I click on

If I open user or workspace settings, everything works fine.

data.title: Repeated snippet placeholder should always inherit
data.body:
* have a snippet like this: `${1:bar}abc${1:foo}`
* insert the snippet
* 🐛 `barabcfoo` is inserted but it should have been `barabcbar`. That is because there is just one placeholder (index=1) that already has a value (bar)

data.title: Remeber which setting I had opened

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
Refs: #30722

1. Open settings, open workspace or some folder setting
2. Close settings
3. Open them again -> I would expect the same settings section is open (workspace or folder) instead I see user settings

1. Open a markdown file.
2. Click the open preview button.

Expected result:
A preview is shown to the side.

Actual result:
Nothing happens.

Another fairly obvious bug. Unlike #30584, the preview tab isn't even shown.
- Nothing in the developer tools console.
- Related command palette functions do nothing as well.

data.title: Comments in settings should be updated
data.body:
Refs: #30722

The comment on top of the folder settings should also say that it overwrites workspace settings.

Same way the workspace settings should also have a comment that they overwrite user settings and maybe additional clarification.

![screen shot 2017-07-19 at 15 11 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/28368451-a98ef416-6c94-11e7-9d6b-108ef9500dc9.png)

data.title: Eliminate Workspace submenu by merging actions into the File menu
data.body:
Testing #30722:

Having workspaces appearing under "Open Recent..." and in the "Workspace" menu is a bit confusing.
I suggest to eliminate the Workspace submenu by merging its actions directly into the corresponding sections of the File menu.

data.title: Workspace settings never get saved
data.body:
Refs: #30722

I know you are currently working on this, however

1. Open workspace settings, add a workspace like a color theme
2. Change to folder settings, change back to workspace setting
3. Notice that the theme setting was not saved and that the default settings are restored

data.title: Only offer applicable settings for folder settings
data.body:
Refs: #30722

Currently only some settings are applied for folder settings, however in intelli-sense everything is offered. 
I would expect that we only offer what is applicable for folder settings.

data.title: Improve wording on "Save Workspace dialog"
data.body:
Testing #30722:

- open an untitled multi-root workspace in VS Code
- try to open a folder in the same window

Observe: you get this dialog: 
![2017-07-19_14-38-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/28367161-10512250-6c90-11e7-8702-9ba20e571def.png)

I don't think that "opened in this window" is really necessary, so I would drop it from the message.

I recommend to use the term "untitled workspace" to make clear what the real reason is. For **named** workspaces you will not be prompted so save.

"Your workspace will be deleted" sounds very aggressive. I suggest to use something like
"You lose your workspace if you don't save it" (but when reading this, it sounds so obvious that I think we should drop the second sentence completely).

In general we should keep the text on these dialogs as short as possible because users don't want to spend lots of time reading these explanations.

data.title: Wrap text with tags (html) deletes word instances starting $ sign
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.1 (2648980a697a4c8fb5777dcfb2ab110cec8a2f58, 2017-07-13T19:08:57.197Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- minify|Hoo|0.3.0 vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16 Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2 htmltagwrap|bra|0.0.3 npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 vscode-npm-source|dku|1.0.0 jquerysnippets|don|0.0.1 flow-for-vscode|flo|0.7.1 knockoutjs|fur|0.1.0 vscode-text-pastry|jkj|1.1.1 vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lon|0.2.3 HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3 csharp|ms-|1.11.0 sublime-keybindings|ms-|2.9.1 team|ms-|1.121.1 debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6 debugger-for-ios-web|msj|0.1.2 vscode-css-peek|pra|1.3.1 vscode-react-native|vsm|0.3.2 change-case|wma|1.0.0 --- Using [knockout.js](http://knockoutjs.com/) data binds in html elements like: ```html
``` If I want to wrap the above in another div tag via CTRL+SHIFT+W, the command strips out the `$data` instance and am left with: ```html
``` Same with `$root`, `$parent` etc. Works fine if the `$` sign is escaped with a backslash. Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: About using Ctrl+R to Switch folder in current window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.1 (2648980a697a4c8fb5777dcfb2ab110cec8a2f58, 2017-07-13T19:18:47.188Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

Steps to Reproduce:

https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_14#_switch-window-improvements

>Press Ctrl+R and leave the Ctrl key pressed. As long as you now press the R key, you can navigate through the list of windows. Release all keys to focus it.

1. have one vscode window opening.
2. want to use Ctrl+R to switch to a recently used window, I press Ctrl+R only once and then release all keys.

Then I have to click the second line to switch to the most recent folder.

Is this by design?
